Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain”
Reviews.Author: wluz
Reviews.Content: For the place and comparing other places to stay Ocean Front is a great deal in the Isabela area..the restaurant is among the best in the area, rooms area clean and simple, prefect for the beach. One thing is the are a bit difficult to find over the phone..

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, depending on what you're here for...”
Reviews.Author: Stacey S
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend has been to PR a number of times and has stayed at this hotel before, so he knew what to expect. We both surf and do not really care about a fancy room with a view or anything like that since the only time we intend to spend in the room is to sleep and shower. The location is perfect if you want to check the surf at Jobos literally by lifting your head off the pillow in the morning. It's also a short drive to a number of other spots on this area of the island. Our room was very small but did have a balcony (which we never used since our boards took up all the space on that side of the room and we couldn't open the door). Beware, there are NO amenities here. Nothing in the shower, no hair dryer, no ice/vending, nothing. Luckily, I was ok being really low maintenance in my appearance on this trip since we spent all of our time at the beach and in the water and everywhere you go is so casual that I just didn't care. We never ate at the restaurant, so I can't speak to that (no breakfast and they are closed on Mondays and Tuesdays fyi). We arrived on a Friday evening and the ocean deck bar was going off. We were exhausted from a long day of travel so decided to grab a drink there.....turned out to be a pretty crazy, party atmosphere and that one drink quickly multiplied; it was a fun night. If it's not the weekend though, do not expect anything to be going on anywhere. Overall, this place was fine for us and our needs, but we are pretty low maintenance (and on a budget). If you require the nicer things in life, I would probably look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Dinner with a view”
Reviews.Author: Kelly H
Reviews.Content: The food was just adequate, good by Puerto Rico standards but the view is spectacular. We were there for Valentine's dinner so the staff was attentive, faster than island time standard. I had the Mahi and my husband had the steak. Both were fine, the potato soup was tasteless and the chocolate cake was dry but that is normal for the resturants we have found in the area. After dinner, we sat at the bar watching the waves break on the rocks from the bar. That was great.

Reviews.Title: “Dump with unprofessional hostile management”
Reviews.Author: Reneecastaway
Reviews.Content: After arriving in Aguadilla from a red eye flight from NYC my boyfriend and I wanted to check out jobos beach and grab some food. There is a stretch of restaurants along Jobos and this place seemed like a nice option compared to nearby spots- turned out to be the worst food and service we've had in our lives and we've travelled the world.... Empty restaurant yet waited an hour for cold food- not lukewarm but COLD. Ordered grilled shrimp skewers and a burger, sent the shrimp back to be brought back out microwaved still not even hot. Burger was cold and inedible.... Offered to pay for the 2 drinks we ordered since we could not eat the food. This was totally not an option with the manager who was so friendly when we came in- he literally said he was going to call the cops on us for stealing!!! We couldve walked out at any time but waited to speak to the manager and reason with him for our dissatisfaction in food we both only took one bite of. He made a scene yelling at us saying we were stealing from him and refused to let us leave the restaurant until we paid for the food which was awful and uneaten. It was totally unprofessional and the worst service, food and treatment we've ever encountered . DONT GO HERE!!

Reviews.Title: “Would'nt stay here if they paid me!!!!”
Reviews.Author: emilie58
Reviews.Content: I read some of the reviews on here. When I saw the place, i thought.....it doesn't look that bad. I really wanted a room with a good view of the ocean so the lady at the front desk gave me keys to 2 rooms and let me decide on one. The first room we opened had the sound of running water. My husband and I walked in and the floor was flooded. We went back to the bathroom and thought the shower was running. Ok, so we won't be staying in the first room. We moved on to the second room. When we walked in it smelled moldy and felt very damp. I looked around for a minute and saw a pile of bugs in the corner, i think they might have been termites. I touched the bed and it was damp, even under the top sheet. I went back to the office and told the lady about the flood and requested a refund. Neither room was acceptable. Apparently a pipe in the toilet broke in the first room. She offered to let me see another room. I had seen enough.....this place is awful!

Reviews.Title: “stay in rincon instead if you can”
Reviews.Author: batianaustin
Reviews.Content: basic hotel, basic amenities, located right along the beach. no breakfast/coffee options on premises or nearby. on-site restaurants closed mon-tues. wireless only works in lobby, not in most rooms. no fridge/microwave/ice. no hot water in sink. had ants in room. stay in rincon if you can. better options, better food selection, wider variety of beaches.

Reviews.Title: “great location, not more than 2 nights!”
Reviews.Author: cristinait
Reviews.Content: This is one of those places that you open the door like in the wizard of OZ and Dorothy opens the door to OZ...It's an excellent location to be with people you know (spouse, significant other, or family). Would necessarily go alone, unless I were a surfer. Rooms are clean, rooms are small, bed is comfortable and amazing views. Went to sleep listening to the waves (loud!!). Also, took long walks on the beach at night, quite peaceful. Not many tourists at all. Just be careful ifi you intend to swim, if you walk down where the surfers are, DO NOT swim there...nearly got swept away by strong current. A local surfer had to rescue us and told us there are casualties there often and mainly tourists! At any even, this hotel would have been ten times better had the restaurant been open. That would be my only complaint that you had to drive to get any kind of food.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach, even better value”
Reviews.Author: VECoxon
Reviews.Content: My family and I traveled to the west side of Puerto Rico to visit this great beach and great little hotel. We had two adjoining rooms for our children (10, 9, & 4) and us. My parents and brother, and his family also joined us for three days. The rooms are clean, the staff is very helpful and the beach, surf, and views are breath taking. This is not a fancy hotel. If you need a clean room with an ocean view and you plan on spending your time on the beach this is an increadible value. The restaurant has great fresh seafood and the bar staff by the beach was great at making virgin pina coladas for the kids. For the price and service, it can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Waste Your Money”
Reviews.Author: onehappyduck
Reviews.Content: I found the Ocean Front Hotel and Restaurant online and read the reviews and thought it sounded like a decent place to stay at for a short vacation. First of all, the place is a dump. It is next to a some spooky house that looks like it burned down years ago, but was never taken down. The beach is not for swimming. It is only a surfers beach, so I had to travel to the other side to go swimming. The rooms are not clean. It was apparent they never changed the sheets. I found human hair on the sheets, piillows and on the floor. The rooms were damp and smelly. The restaurant worker told me that there were no ice machines in the hotel and that I could walk down the road to the store to get some ice, but there were no ice buckets in the room. The bar which is next to the hotel is not owned by the hotel, but it is local and the customers are very local. Not a safe place for a group of girls to hang out. My overall experience was terrible. I did not feel safe at this hotel and the overall location of the hotel was not easy to locate. Trust me, don't waste your money, the place is a dump.

Reviews.Title: “Unreliable and bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: Joule36
Reviews.Content: I am very dissapointed with Ocean Front staff. I made a reservation for Valentine's Day weekend since I wanted to spend a few relaxing days with my wife. We live in San Juan and traveled about two and a half hours to Isabela. Approximately 10 mins from the hotel (5:30 pm), a lady called and informed us that the room was no longer available since someone at the reservation desk made a mistake and there were no other vacancies. We made the reservation a week in advance. This was an awful experience and confirmed the lack of professionality from hotel staff. I will also give them 0% in customer service skills since there were no attempts or interest to help us. At least, they could have called a day before, offered us another night at a lower rate or even recommend a nearby establishment. There was no interest whatsoever in rectifying this situation. I would not recommend this "hotel" to anyone since this attitude is not acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Great view and good food!”
Reviews.Author: soleilmama
Reviews.Content: This was an unplanned stop due to the rain in the east side of the island where we were staying. There were plenty of rooms available and the desk clerk offered to show us rooms right away. They were both spartan and she let us know that there would be music that night and which room would be the quiet one. The room we chose had a great view of the public beach area and the surfers, although a bit further away than other accommodations. It had been freshly painted and looked clean. The bed was really hard and the tv was way too far up at the ceiling so it was hard to watch unless you were lying down. We don't have a TV at home so it was no big deal to us, but it might be to some. The decks off of the room were great and had a beautiful view. The popular public beach area was a short walk and there were plenty of places along the walk to stop in for a drink. We did not eat in the main restaurant, but ordered food from the bar area outside. Best meal we had in Puerto Rico- outside of San Juan. Live music - playing 80s rock started about 10:30 or so. Sounded lively, but we were so tired we never made it downstairs. I thought $100 was a bit pricy for this room, but it seemed par for the course.

Reviews.Title: “puerto rico”
Reviews.Author: p3i
Reviews.Content: Loved the Ocean front, really nice place for ok price........ Jobos beach is a beautiful place to stay, I hope they got a ATM now, i allmost got stuck there bÂ´cause i didÂ´nt have any cash on me when i got there........... that was i 2004,so i guess things changed. p3i, sweden

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Little Place”
Reviews.Author: BroncoBill
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a stay at this hotel, and it's location, view, and helpful staff will definately make me return. The rooms are a very nice size, but very basic, and immaculately clean. I had a corner room with an ocean view on one side, and looking down the beach on the other for 75.00 per night. During the week, it is very quiet with no restaurants open, however on the weekends they have music, and food inside and outside. The food at the restaurant was WAY above excellent and presented beautifully. I wound up eating there every night. There are a couple of beach bars within walking distance that also have food. The hotel is about a 10 minute drive from the Aguadilla airport, and if you're on a budget but want an ocean view----it's the place to go. Bring an inexpensive coffeemaker and you're all set.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a bargain and it's great.”
Reviews.Author: BajurasFan
Reviews.Content: I can't believe that anyone had a bad experience in the Ocean Front. It is a lovely place with a good restaurant, a great outdoor bar, comfortable rooms, friendly owners and staff. I have stayed there 4 or 5 times over the last several years, and always enjoyed the stay. I no longer stay there, because we loved the area so much that we bought a nearby apartment, but I still make the Ocean Front my first stop on arrival for a drink and to see the people at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the Photoshopped Brochure -- Stay at Mar Hau Instead”
Reviews.Author: SN1752
Reviews.Content: I had planned a circumnavigation of Puerto Rico & knew I wanted to stop in Isabela. Using the Go To Puerto Rico website I located the Ocean Front and the price seemed reasonable and the location attractive; I booked two nights. Upon arrival from Old San Juan I was a bit wary. The directions were horrendous and after getting lost several times I located the establishment. It is right on a busy street and you must park across the street after registration. It it is set up a bit like a brothel with a bar on the 1st floor and a long hallway on the 2nd floor with rooms on both sides. I knew I was in trouble when a large sign stated that no barbecues were allowed on the balconies -- the balconies jut out 2 feet from the room & a chair doesn't even fit. The food in the bar/restaurant was passable and they do have a nice open-air bar next to the hotel. You cannot charge anything to your room and payment is up-front. The view is beautiful but you cannot swim on the beach -- take your pick as to why: 1) the surf is too strong, &/or 2) all the trash washes in right in front of the hotel. When I retired to my room for the night the A/C didn't work, the TV was out of order & there were bugs in the bathroom. There wasn't anyone on duty to address these issues. Needless to say I only stayed 1 of the 2 nights (but I'd paid ahead & couldn't get a refund). When I woke up the next morning I headed over to Mar Hau & thank god they had vacancies. Mar Hau is the best in the area, cheaper than Ocean Front, the food is better (the Mar Hau restaurant is a certified meson gastronomico), and has an ideal beach location. I would only stay at the Ocean Front if my car had broken down & there were absolutely no options. Otherwise I'd head to Mar Hau or go on to the next town.
